name: Slippbarinn - Old Harbor's First Craft Cocktail Bar
description: Slippbarinn pioneered craft cocktail culture in Reykjavík's Old Harbor when it opened at the stylish Icelandair Hotel Reykjavík Marina on Mýrargata 2, establishing the neighborhood's first serious cocktail bar and creating destination that attracts both hotel guests seeking sophisticated drinks without leaving the property and Reykjavík residents making special trips to experience ever-changing cocktail menus that showcase mixology creativity and Icelandic ingredients. The bar's concept explicitly embraces perpetual evolution—management describes Slippbarinn as a venue that "will never be fully formed but ever-changing," creating dynamic environment where diverse cocktail menus represent collections of creative experiments rather than static offerings that remain identical month after month, year after year. This philosophy attracts cocktail enthusiasts who seek novelty and innovation rather than predictable classics, though the bar maintains some signature drinks that have become house specialties. The "Harbor Mule" and "Icelandic Spritz" exemplify Slippbarinn's approach of blending traditional cocktail structures (the Moscow Mule's ginger beer and vodka combination, the Spritz's bubbly wine and bitter aperitif format) with contemporary twists and local Icelandic ingredients that might include wild herbs foraged from Icelandic hillsides, rhubarb grown in geothermal greenhouses, birch sap tapped from Iceland's limited tree populations, or artisanal Icelandic spirits distilled from local grains or potatoes.
address: Mýrargata 2, 101 Reykjavík (Icelandair Hotel Reykjavík Marina, Old Harbor)
